message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SE 

The paper deals with the issue of learning in adversarial settings, specifically in the context of security applications. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. The paper also focuses on feature selection methods in machine learning, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of these methods in the context of malware detection, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the need for specific countermeasures, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) sub-category.
